revised_title: Catalytic Transference of Hydrogen in Organic Compounds: Simultaneous Dehydrogenation and Hydrogenation
tldr: The authors investigate the catalytic action of metallic nickel in transferring hydrogen from saturated to unsaturated organic compounds in the liquid state. They discover that simultaneous dehydrogenation and hydrogenation can occur at temperatures near the hydrogenation range, suggesting a new mechanism involving an intermediate system of the organic compounds, nickel, and hydrogen.
